column1: # C-GEM Calibration Targets: Mekong Delta (Dry Season)
#   INTRUSION_LEN  = Distance [km] where variable drops below threshold
#   TIDAL_RANGE    = Max - Min water level [m] at TargetValue km from mouth
# Weights: Higher = more important in optimization
#   - Nguyen et al. (2008): Salinity intrusion 40-60 km for 4 PSU
#   - Fujii et al. (2003): Vam Nao mean velocity 0.2-0.5 m/s
#   - MRC Water Quality Database: O2 > 4 mg/L in main stems
# Tidal range at mouths (Should be 2-3 m for Mekong dry season)
# Salt intrusion length (4 PSU isohaline should reach 40-60 km in dry season)
# Vam Nao mean velocity (Tien→Hau transfer: 0.2-0.5 m/s positive)
# Salinity gradient hierarchy (Ham_Luong > Co_Chien due to depth)
# Target: Mean salinity should reflect depth-dependent intrusion
# Estuarine Turbidity Maximum location (should be 20-40 km from mouth)
# SPM concentration at ETM (50-200 mg/L typical for Mekong)
# Dissolved Oxygen: Must stay > 4 mg/L (125 µmol/L) in main stems
# This is critical for fisheries and ecosystem health
# O2 should be near saturation at mouth (~200-220 µmol/L at 28°C)
# Ammonium: Should be low (<5 µmol/L) except at pollution hotspots
